column4: i just lost all internet access in ubuntu. i think its a software issue, as i can get online on all my other boxes and from winxp, which i have installed on that same box. any help would be appreciated.
also sorry about the caps before
run the command ifconfig and pastebin it please
ifconfig didnt fix it, and it said command not found when i typed in pastebin it
No no, open a terminal and run the command ifconfig then run the command iwconfig then copy all that into a pastebin so I can read it
ok, this will take me a minute, as i have to move the info from my computer to this one and then upload
Er, ok.
here you go. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/50633/
: here it is. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/50633/
I apologize, I dozed off...I am really sorry, I am back
my sincerest apologies I am getting over a cold and I closed my eyes and lost 20 minutes....
no problem, i understand. heres the ifconfig printout, if you didnt get it before. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/50633/
Are you able to ping your router?
no
i cant ping my router
What is the router IP? should be 192.168.1.1, right? What error are you getting when you ping it?
its actually 192.168.0.1, and it doesnt give me an error, its just sort of been sitting there for about 10 minutes
silent_: i dont see anything horribly wrong with anything either, should I try putting a livecd in to see if its just the way my network card is now working with ubuntu for some reason?
Just use terminal and type route
Dude, that's your router setup page?
its what i get when i type 192.198.0.1 into firefox. i can send the manual setup page screenshot too
silent_: it is xp. like i said, the only computer running linux is the one with the problem
silent_: all the cables are fine, that was the first thing i checked. and i ran the cmd, and it said reconfiguring network interfaces... [ok]
